title: Software Engineer
description: Do you want to be part of KPMG´s newly established function?   KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected professional services firms in the world.   Our new function, Lighthouse, leverages the latest KPMG data, analytics, intelligent automation and artificial intelligence technologies to help build and deliver solutions for clients’ unique business needs.   Lighthouse is now recruiting front-end and full-stack software engineers. We work with clients across different sectors such as healthcare, defense, transportation, infrastructure, communications, energy/natural resources, financial services, leisure, retail and manufacturing. As a Software Engineer, you will design, build and maintain efficient, reusable and reliable code. From architecture to testing, you will be solving complex problems as part of a team as well as individually. You will be working in an Agile way. Our values At KPMG our values define who we are and the way we do business. As a leading professional services firm, we know that our strength and capability come from our people and their different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds. From our inclusive leadership strategy to our diversity and inclusion targets, we’re making bold changes to who we are and what we do, and you will be a part of it. Technical Skills Undergraduate degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or equivalent At least 2 years of work experience and practical exposure to React Practical exposure to at least one public cloud provider: Azure, AWS, GCP, etc. Practical exposure to some form of database Practical exposure to working in an Agile environment is a plus Non-Technical Skills You enjoy solving complex problems and getting any job well done You are a team player and collaborate flawlessly You communicate exceptionally well both verbally and in written form in English You work well under pressure, manage your time and learn new concepts quickly You are committed to documenting your code and testing it thoroughly You can teach your skills to others when needed You are VERY attentive to detail Want to make a difference with us? Once your application is received, you will go through the following stages: Phase 1 – Inception:  Reviewers will check your CV and screening questions. Phase 2 – First Interview:  When you pass phase 1, you will have a video interview in which you will have to solve a theoretical problem. This typically lasts under 1 hour. Phase 3 – Case Presentation:  When you pass phase 2 – you will be presented with a real-world case – you will need to build and present your solution to our team. title: Software Engineer I
description: Si vous êtes un développeur de logiciels à la recherche de nouveaux défis et désirant avoir un impact significatif au sein d’un des plus grands sites de commerce électronique dans le domaine du voyage, vous êtes au bon endroit! L’équipe Plateforme de contenu est la recherche de développeurs passionnés par la création de solutions logicielles dans un environnement agile. À propos de l’équipe Plateforme de contenu Dans Notre Équipe Vous Trouverez Des Défis Tels Que L’équipe de Plateforme de contenu est établie à Montréal depuis environ 10 ans et a pour mission de fournir le meilleur contenu à toutes les marques de commerce d’Expedia. Distribution de contenu à haut débit sur plusieurs sites transactionnels à travers la planète. Localisation de contenu dans plus de 40 langues pour toutes les équipes d’Expedia. Génération de texte basé sur des données factuelles pour plusieurs secteurs d’activité liés au voyage. Plusieurs projets d’apprentissage par machine afin d’optimiser l’acquisition de contenu, la déduplication et l’extraction de métadonnées. Dans ce rôle, vous pouvez vous attendre à... Concevoir, développer, déboguer, supporter et modifier des applications et des outils logiciels dans un environnement agile. Travailler sur des projets ayant un impact direct sur les clients et soutenir les initiatives stratégiques des marques ou des unités d'affaires. Rejoindre un environnement énergétique où la proactivité et la contribution de chaque membre de l'équipe est important. Développer dans un environnement où les livrables incluent un produit de haute qualité via des tests unitaires, des analyses de code, des tests d'intégration. Faites partie d'une équipe avec une forte volonté de fournir des résultats qui apportent de la valeur à l'entreprise. Développer en utilisant les meilleures pratiques d’intégration continue (DevOps) ainsi que certaines des meilleures technologies infonuagiques. Ce que nous recherchons Un minimum de 2 ans d'expérience en tant que développeur de logiciel dans l'écosystème Java. Une bonne connaissance de Java 11, Spring, Springboot. La connaissance de Kotlin, AWS, Kubernetes, GraphQL, de l’expérience dans le développement d’interfaces utilisateur et de travail dans un environnement Agile/Kanban sont un atout. Intérêt pour l'intégration continue / infrastructure de livraison continue. Une volonté et une capacité d'apprendre de nouvelles technologies. Un excellent esprit d'équipe. Une capacité à communiquer avec les parties prenantes ayant différents rôles et appartenant à différentes unités d'affaires. Bon niveau de communication, anglais courant (français un atout); Diplôme de baccalauréat ou supérieur. Les normes culturelles sont l’essence d’Expedia Nous croyons en la différence . Nous recherchons de nouvelles idées, de nouvelles façons de penser, différents contextes et différentes approches, car la normalité peut mentir et la similitude est dangereuse. Ainsi, nos normes ne sont ni des règles, ni des principes universels applicables à tous les niveaux de notre entreprise. Toutefois, elles sont fondamentales à notre identité et à la collaboration entre tous nos employés. Et à l’instar de notre entreprise, ces normes évoluent. Nous sommes transparents . Nous communiquons de manière ouverte et franche à tous les niveaux, avec nos supérieurs, nos collègues et nos collaborateurs. Nous faisons apparaître rapidement les problèmes difficiles, nous agissons, nous apprenons. Nous faisons preuve de diligence . Nous cherchons à recueillir les informations le plus rapidement possible et nous réagissons. La réactivité nous permet de faire des erreurs, et de nous améliorer sans cesse. Nous croyons en la méthode scientifique . Face aux données objectives, les idées de chacun sont sur un pied d’égalité. Nous les utilisons pour nous guider, et non pour définir nos actions. Nous dirigeons avec humilité . Chez nous, les responsables sont au service de leurs équipes. Personne parmi nous ne détient toutes les réponses, mais nous sommes de nature curieuse et nous cherchons toujours à apprendre. Bien que nos responsables assument avec la plus grande rigueur leurs responsabilités envers notre entreprise et leurs équipes, ils ne se prennent toutefois jamais au sérieux. Nous agissons en tant qu’équipe . Nous visons l’optimisation pour le bien de tous et non seulement dans notre propre intérêt, ni celui de nos équipes. La réussite des autres nous intéresse vivement. Les projets sur lesquels vous travaillez chez Expedia permettent d’améliorer l’expérience de millions de voyageurs du monde entier, en plus de connecter les gens et de les outiller en matière de voyages. Expedia s’engage à créer un milieu de travail accueillant comptant un effectif diversifié. Toutes les candidatures admissibles seront examinées sans égard à la race, à la religion, au genre, à l’orientation sexuelle, à l’origine ethnique, aux handicaps ou à l’âge. À propos d’Expedia, Inc. Notre mandat est de révolutionner le monde du voyage grâce à la puissance de la technologie. Collectivement, les marques d’Expedia, Inc. couvrent tous les aspects du voyage, que ce soit pour la recherche, la planification, les réservations, la sélection du meilleur siège d’avion, la lecture d’évaluations d’hôtels par les clients ou la planification des activités durant le séjour. Les marques Expedia, Inc. s’adressent tant aux vacanciers qu’aux voyageurs d’affaires et répondent à tous les goûts et à tous les budgets, des plus modestes aux plus luxueux. Expedia répond à la demande des consommateurs en matière de voyage sur pratiquement tous les continents en les dirigeants vers nos fournisseurs de services, qui représentent près de 149 000 hôtels ainsi que des centaines de compagnies aériennes, de voyagistes, d’entreprises de location de voitures et de services à destination. Visitez le site http://www.expediainc.com/expedia-brands/ pour en apprendre davantage au sujet de nos marques. In English Software Developer If you are a Software Developer seeking new exciting challenges where you can make an impact working for one of the largest Online Travel Ecommerce web sites in the world, look no further. In our team you will find challenges such as: High-volume content distribution across multiple transactional sites around the globe. Localization of content in more than 40 languages for all Expedia teams. Fact-based text generation for several lines of business. Multiple machine learning projects to optimize content acquisition, deduplication and metadata extraction. Working on projects that have a direct impact on customers and support strategic initiatives of brands or business units. Joining an energetic environment where each team member's proactivity and contribution is important. Developing in an environment where the definition of done includes high quality deliverables via unit testing, code review, integration testing. Be part of a team with a strong will to deliver results that brings value to the business. Develop using best practices of continuous integration (DevOps) as well as some of the best cloud technologies. Who You Are A minimum of 2 years of experience as a software developer in the Java ecosystem. A good knowledge of Java 11 or more, Spring, Spring Boot. A strong will and ability to learn new technologies. An excellent team spirit. An ability to communicate with stakeholders having various roles and belonging to different business units. Fluent English (French is also an asset). Bachelor's degree or higher. Why Join Us Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better –   that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.   Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares. If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you. Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, Vrbo®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com™, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® Cruise® and SilverRail Technologies, Inc. For more information, visit www.expediagroup.com . Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.

description: About the Team* The Marketplace Fulfilment Team is responsible for the entire post order experience at Swiggy. The technology solutions built by Marketplace Fulfilment Platform (MFP) Team are at the heart of Swiggy’s ability to deliver food to Customers. These systems power and affect the entire journey of a customer’s order; from predicting SLAs for a given set of restaurants using AI models when the app is opened, to the time the order is delivered to the Customer’s doorstep. The team’s charter encompasses all aspects of order fulfilment & logistics, from planning the delivery fleet within a city/zone by time of day, to sophisticated algorithms and ML models that assign orders within minutes, in order to deliver the order within a 30-45min time slot, while maximising utilisation and efficiency of the fleet, to monitoring the order and automating interventions to handle exceptional conditions. With Swiggy’s unparalleled hyperlocal density, our Maps and Data Sciences team leverage the travel time data of Delivery Partners currently delivering orders, joined with our historical data to enable the speed and compliance of predicted SLAs, in the face of varying traffic condition and item preparation times in different cities, zones and restaurants, and providing live tracking of the order status and driver journey to Customers. Visit our tech blogs to learn more about some the challenges we deal with: https://bytes.swiggy.com/the-swiggy-delivery-challenge-part-one-6a2abb4f82f6 https://bytes.swiggy.com/swiggy-distance-service-9868dcf613f4 https://bytes.swiggy.com/the-tech-that-brings-you-your-food-1a7926229886 What Challenges would you get to work On? Logistics (Serviceability, Assignment, Simulation)- Or Driver Experience (Driver Acquisition & On-boarding, Driver Retention & Pay-outs, Fleet Planning) or CRM (Agent Workbench, Customer Touchpoint Automation, Live Tracking Screen) What do we look for? Good problem-solving skills Strong technical aptitude and good knowledge of CS fundamentals Sound knowledge and application of algorithms and data structures with space and time complexities Good knowledge of object-oriented programming with proficiency in at least one programming language like Java, Golang, Python etc Follow industry coding standards and responsible for writing maintainable/scalable/efficient code to solve business problems Hands-on experience of working with Databases and Linux/Unix platform B Tech/M Tech in Computer Science or equivalent from a reputed college Minimum 0.6 years of Experience in Product Development Company About Swiggy Founded in 2014, Swiggy is India’s leading on-demand delivery platform with a vision to elevate the quality of life for the urban consumer by oﬀering unparalleled convenience — through services like Food Delivery, Swiggy Stores, Swiggy Genie, Culinary Businesses such as Access, Brandworks and Private Brands. The platform connects consumers to over 1,60,000 Restaurant Partners across 520+ Cities. Using innovative technology and deep consumer insights, Swiggy is committed to provide a hassle-free, fast and reliable delivery experience. Every order delivered by Swiggy’s ﬂeet of 2.4 lakh + active Delivery Partners — the largest in India ensures a host of customer-centric features like lightning-fast delivery, no minimum order value, live order tracking, and 24/7 customer support, to name a few.

title: Software Engineer, Backend
description: Software Engineer, Backend Slack is looking for Backend Engineers to build features, design and implement API methods, and improve the performance and reliability of our systems as we rapidly scale our product and organization. We build our app using reliable tools that our team knows and trusts, including PHP/Hack, Java, MySQL, and Linux. Expertise in these areas is a huge plus, but having familiarity with other common web languages (such as Python or Ruby) and other relational databases are fine substitutes. We’re a collaborative team who genuinely enjoys working together with a cross-functional team of product managers, designers, frontend, iOS, Android, automation, and quality engineers to make Slack a better product. We are looking for engineers that understand that simplicity and reliability are aspects of a system to be carefully calculated with every decision made. A Taste Of Our Scale And Reach Users spend over 10 hours connected and 2+ hours active in Slack every work day. 10M+ Daily Active Users in more than 150 countries. 1.5 billion messages are sent per month, half of those outside the United States. Every day we see over 3.5 million simultaneously connected users, over 3.5 billion web requests, over 42 billion database queries per day, and our systems see over 1 million queries/second in our caching tier. We have 8.8M+ app installations with 155,000 weekly active developers building on the developer platform. 90% of our paid teams on Slack actively use apps. Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello? What You Will Be Doing You'll brainstorm with Product Managers, Designers, Backend, and Frontend Engineers on your team to conceptualize and build new features for our large (and growing!) user base. You’ll produce high-quality results by contributing heavily to team projects that have a significant impact on the business. You’ll actively own team features or systems and define their long-term health, while also improving the health of surrounding systems. You'll assist our skilled support team and operations team in triaging and resolving production issues. You'll mentor other engineers and deeply review code. You’ll improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes What You Should Have You’ve been building web applications professionally for 2+ years. You have experience with functional or imperative programming languages -- e.g., PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, C, or Java. You can contribute to technical architecture discussions and help drive technical decisions within your team. You write understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability. You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you. You possess strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval. You have completed a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience. Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens. Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Slack’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work. Come do the best work of your life here at Slack.

title: Software Engineer- Data Platform
description: Company Description Twitter serves the public conversation because conversation is a force for good in the world. The opportunity to help the world connect, debate, learn, and solve problems is what draws us to careers at Twitter, and it’s what keeps us here. Job Description Who We Are As engineers on the Data Platform team, our mission is to build the fastest, most reliable, and largest-scale data processing technologies in the world - able to cope with ever-increasing volumes of data in real-time - and then apply them to the company’s most critical and fundamental data problems. As a member of the team, you will be the “source of truth” for Twitter’s most fundamental data - such as Tweet content, engagement data, and user relationships - along with core metrics such as daily and monthly active users. You will surface these datasets in real-time to mission-critical products and business applications throughout the company. You will empower dozens of engineering teams, hundreds of co-workers, and millions of users to dream of new insights and new possibilities. What You’ll Do If this sounds like a team you want to be a part of, fantastic! We are looking for experienced engineers who love writing code, data engineering, understanding our customers, and collaborating with teammates to ship useful software. Sample projects we’ve built Real-time aggregations of interactions on tweets at ~5M/sec scale Unify our batch processing pipelines that count and validate user activity Use hidden Markov modeling to categorize users’ tweeting states Who You Are You take satisfaction in building resilient, performant, and thoroughly tested distributed systems that can power the most business-critical applications. You get stuff done and thrive in a small group environment. You have a strong sense of ownership and a curiosity to understand how things work, even if they take you outside your area of expertise. You welcome feedback on are constantly looking for ways to improve yourself.

title: Graduate Software Engineer

We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.
